entry.title: Sher Shah Suri (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sher Shah Suri (pictured) was often referred to as the "Just King"?

entry.title: Wawa Airport (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Wawa Airport's first commercial flights began three weeks before it officially opened?

entry.title: Jordan Love (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after starting the first game of the 2023 NFL season, Jordan Love became only the third quarterback since 1993 to start Week 1 for the Green Bay Packers, following Brett Favre and Aaron Rodgers?

entry.title: Lautaro (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the position of the volcano Lautaro was only clarified thanks to aerial imagery?

entry.title: Noah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that British child artist Noah created the backgrounds for paintings by worldwide celebrities including Ed Sheeran?

entry.title: Sugarbush Hill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that there have been ongoing conflicts for decades about whether Sugarbush Hill is the highest point in Wisconsin?

entry.title: releasing 52 songs in the span of one year (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that country musician Kristian Bush celebrated his 52nd birthday by releasing 52 songs in the span of one year?

entry.title: Annie Rauwerda (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Annie Rauwerda's stew cooked for more than 60 days and had around 300 contributors?
